questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

A company uses Dynamics 365 Finance.

You implement the SysOperation framework to create the following batch processes.

//IMG//


You need to configure the execution mode for each batch process.

Which execution modes should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate execution modes to the correct requirements. Each execution mode may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
The provided Answer is Correct:
1. Reliable Asynchronous: This mode is typically used for critical or long-running processes where ensuring completion and handling failures is essential to ensure that the operation is successfully completed.
2. Synchronous.
3. Asynchronous: this mode does not provide guarantees about the completion or success of the operation, and there is a possibility of failure or partial execution.

Right order is Async, Sync and Reliable Async.
[There are four mode to run SysOperation Serice:
a. Async: Responsive for AxClient and good for lengthy process that has low need for durablity.
b. Sync: Freeze the AxClient. Good for short process.
c. Reliable Async: Works like unscheduled batch run in this mode.
d. Scheduled Bactch: As the name goes.
]

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You are developing a Power BI report.

The report must show the number of past due invoices in near real time.

You need to embed the report in the Analytics tab of a Vendor Payments workspace.

What should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Looks correct to me. 

DirectQuery in Power BI offers the greatest benefits in the following scenarios:
The data changes frequently, and you need near real-time reporting.
You need to handle large data without having to pre-aggregate.
The underlying source defines and applies security rules.
Data sovereignty restrictions apply.

Correct.
The foreign key relationship is added on the child to reference the parent.
The RowId and ParentRowId fields should be added to all staging tables for the composite entity.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You are a Dynamics 365 Finance developer.
You have the following entities.
//IMG//

You must create the required fields and relationships in the staging tables.
You need to develop a composite entity that uses the OrderHeader and OrderLine entities.
Which object should you use for each action? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
In fact all formats are supported currently !
From : https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/analytics/general-electronic-reporting
==> ER currently supports the TEXT, XML, JSON, PDF, Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, and OPENXML worksheet formats.

questions.question_text:
An error message displays when a user tries to save an outgoing electronic reporting document.

You need to ensure that the document format supports electronic reporting.

Which three formats can you use? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

To track changes for sales header information using data entities and enable the primary table, you can follow these steps:

Enable Change Tracking: In Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations, change tracking can be enabled for both BYOD (Bring Your Own Database) and non-BYOD scenarios. This allows for incremental export of data where only records that have changed are exported1.
Configure Entity Export: In the Data management workspace, select ‘Configure entity export to database’. Choose the database to export data to and select 'Publish’1.
Select Change Tracking Option: For the published entity, select ‘Change tracking’. Choose ‘Enable primary table’ to track changes made to any fields in the primary table. Changes in secondary tables won’t trigger a change in the entity1.

C

Selected Answer: C
I think this should be C. Custom query is used when you only care about some fields, but it states you want to enable tracking for the table, so using Primary table would be the best option

questions.question_text:
You develop apps for Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.

You need to track changes only for sales header information by using data entities.

Which change tracking option should you use?
